column3: utACK\n\nNice find! Can't believe I didn't catch this one myself :-)
super-micro nit: can you please correct the function name in the commit message?\n

Yeah, in older versions of the SegWit patch, fetch flags were based on the chain instead of explicit announcements. That led to too many edge cases to deal with, however. The dependency on pprev/params can safely go away.
@sipa @NicolasDorier thanks for the explanation, so this change makes sense in that context\nutACK 1ff2bb4

Any idea *why* these were being passed?\nLooked back in history and to me it seems that `CBlockIndex* pprev, const Consensus::Params& chainparams` were never used at all, since introduced in b8a97498df1e83f8dcc49bc3fa4344f9e9799242.\n@sipa @NicolasDorier  maybe?
